sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Portuguese doctors join medics around Europe demanding fairer conditions for workers in the National Health Service.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Despite an increase in fighting around Bakhmut, the Ukrainian president has visited troops on the front line and other parts of the Donetsk region.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Portuguese doctors are seeking higher pay and fewer overtime hours.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Protesting outside a conference hosted by the World Health Organization and the Portuguese government, the doctors demanded more support for health workers.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: They are deeply concerned about the state of Portugal's national health service, with doctors stretched so thin that many people are lacking a general practitioner and some hospital services closing.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The medical doctors in Portugal want to be in the NHS. Unfortunately, since our salaries are so low and our working conditions are so bad, the government is not listening to us, is doing nothing to keep us in the NHS. So it's their entire responsibility for this ugly situation.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: We have a lot of patients for each medical doctor. We would like to have fewer patients in our list because this way we could have more time to be with them and take care of them and that care of them.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: And that is also one of the things we are fighting for.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Their demands are similar to those in the United Kingdom and France, where medical workers have also urged the government to hire more doctors and raise wages.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The Portuguese government has been negotiating with the unions, but so far there is no agreement with future strikes planned.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: We are trying to make an agreement with trade unions.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Of course, it's never an easy issue.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: And try to promote new ways of organization.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Healthy doctors, healthy people. That's the chant coming from Portuguese doctors today outside the World Health Organization's symposium on digital health systems.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Like in many other European countries, Portuguese health workers say that they want a public system that's better funded with more doctors.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: They say their colleagues are going to the private sector and even moving to other countries, and they want the government and the health ministry to hear their concerns.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Lauren Chadwick, Euronews.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Despite an intensification in fighting around Bakhmut, the Ukrainian president has visited troops in the frontline town and other parts of the Donetsk region.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Volodymyr Zelensky stopped at a command center near the ruined town that remains under Russian control despite recent Ukrainian advances.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Elsewhere in Donetsk, Zelenskyy inspected an operations hub and handed out medals.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: His presence is seen as an attempt to boost morale as Ukraine's counteroffensive struggles to make dramatic gains.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: That's mainly due to the extensive fortifications Russia has set up along the front line.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: But Moscow says its soldiers are staging offensive operations in some areas.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Civilians continue to be caught in the middle.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Residents are being evacuated from Orekiv in Zaporizhia, which is said to be under almost constant Russian shelling.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Ukrainian light infantry has advanced to positions beyond anti-tank ditches and dragon's teeth anti-tank obstacles that comprise the current Russian defensive layer ahead of the Ukrainian advance in western Zaporizhia region. And Ukrainian forces likely intend to hold these positions, says the Institute for the Study of War. Here is animated illustration of the observed Ukrainian progress in newly available geolocated evidence from the past 24 hours the Institute for the study of war is warning it is not prepared to assess that Ukrainian forces have breached this Russian defensive layer in the absence of observed Ukrainian heavy equipment in these areas so what is the g-allegated footage that is available the Institute for the study of war says Ukrainian forces advanced to three-line positions that are east of the Russian anti-tank ditches and dragon's teeth obstacles that are part of a tri-layered defense immediately west of where Bover that is here this is about 18 kilometers southeast from or you let's take a closer look there are also indications that Ukrainian forces have advanced up to Russian defensive positions between Robota and novo pro copia there it is in this area now the Institute for the study of wars as Ukrainian forces are Institute for the Study of Wars as Ukrainian forces are widening the bridge they have already made in one Russian defensive layer and are reportedly maneuvering more equipment and personnel into tactical rear areas of this layer according to a US official North Korean leader Kim Jong-un may travel to Russia soon

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: to meet with President Vladimir Putin as the Kremlin tries to acquire military equipment for use in its war in Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: It's not exactly known where or when the meeting will take place, but the Pacific port city of Vladivostok could be a possibility given its relative proximity to North Korea.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Is what the Kremlin answered to rumors.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The Russian defense minister traveled to Pyongyang recently to try to persuade North Korea to sell artillery ammunition to Russia.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: We know that Russia is engaged in trade with North Korea and definitely North Korea is a thorny issue for regional security in Northeast Asia and for the US and its allies.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: And that's where Russia really wants to prop up North Korea to create more troubles to the United States.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The two countries are even considering holding their first-ever military exercises.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Russia seeks to quash the Ukrainian counter-offensive, while North Korea is extending a record number of missile tests to protest U.S. military actions.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: The U.S. ambassador to the EU has told Euronews that any meeting between Moscow and North Korea would mean the West's strategy vis-a-vis Russia is working.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: According to Mark Gittinstein, Vladimir Putin has already lost the war.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: For Putin to go to North Korea for arms is an indication that our strategy is working.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Our export controls and sanctions have just knocked his military back to the 19th century.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: So he's going to another country that he would never go to otherwise to get military equipment.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: And to me it's an indication of Putin's failure and our success.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: So meanwhile, when you see Vladimir Putin the Russian president this week with the Turkish head of state Erdogan threatening saying that if you don't stop the sanctions I will not sign up onto a new grain deal in the Black Sea, how do you react to that?

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Look the most important thing is not to believe Putin's lies.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: He's bombing the silos, he started this war. He's the one that's causing the food crisis around the world. People are starving because of his decisions. And here in Brussels, of course, they rely on you as well. Do you see the support there still? Are Americans, who will of course vote next year, are they still very supportive of the Ukrainians? Americans, I like to believe, are a lot like I do, like I am. I watch television every day.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: It's like watching World War II on livestream.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: I mean, when you see Russians bombing maternity wards or blowing up apartment buildings, your natural moral instinct is to say, we've got to do something about it.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: And I think that's how they act in the United States when I talk to them and even Republican senators who I talk to often when they come here say the same thing to me we'll be with you as long as uh you need us are you sure are we seeing that in not not all of them enough of them and we have all of the Democrats so I'm pretty confident we'll be fine even though a lot of U.S officials were critical as well of the counteroffensive, saying it was too slow.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: There are a lot of people who are very happy with the way it's going and understand how difficult breaking a defensive regime like this is.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: When you have a fascist government run by a military that will do anything, it's hard to break that hole.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: But you know, just like we did in World War II, these Ukrainians will do the same thing.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: I just got back from the D-Day beaches in Normandy, and I saw how difficult that is.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: I'm very confident the Ukrainians will win this, and I already know that Putin has lost it.

sentences.sentence: Russian combat helicopters have played a major role in the invasion of Ukraine, particularly

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: along the front line.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: But not all airmen have agreed with what they were doing, it seems.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: One helicopter pilot who reportedly defected to Ukraine by flying across the border has been outlining his reasons.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: He spoke to reporters in Russia.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Yes, I have a relatively good salary, two apartments, almost a pension.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: I had a lot of things to keep in mind, but now it's not important to me.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: For me, the most important thing was not to take part in these crimes.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Kuzminov is now considering joining Ukrainian aviation.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The fate of two other crew members on board the helicopter remains unclear.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Hundreds of Moroccans gathered outside the parliament in Rabat

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: to denounce the shooting dead of two holidaymakers by the Algerian Coast Guard last Tuesday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The pair had been jet-skiing in Moroccan waters when they strayed across the maritime border between the two Mediterranean countries.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The demonstrators accused the government in Rabat of not doing enough to challenge the Algerian authorities.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The Algerian Defense Ministry claims the tourists had to fight in order to stop several times.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The Spanish Football Federation has fired the women's national team coach Jorge Vilda less than three weeks after his team won the Women's World Cup title and amid the controversy involving suspended Federation president Luis Rubiales.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Jorge Vilda was among those who applauded Rubiales when he refused to resign despite facing widespread criticism.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Rubiales who kissed player Jenny Hermoso without consent after the final has been provisionally suspended by FIFA and is facing a Spanish government case against him.
